metadata.title: CVE-2016-1653 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The LoadBuffer implementation in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before50.0.2661.75, mishandles data types, which allows remote attackers to causea denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via craftedJavaScript code that triggers an out-of-bounds write operation, related tocompiler/pipeline.cc and compiler/simplified-lowering.cc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
